ITTIA DB IoT C API Reference  8.4.1
Typedefs | Enumerations | Functions
Data Stream
C API

Data streams provide a way to query, filter, and store data in real time. More...

Typedefs

typedef struct db_stream_graph_s * db_stream_graph_t
 The db_stream_graph_t struct defines a streaming graph.
 
typedef struct db_stream_node_s * db_stream_node_t
 The db_stream_node_t struct defines a node in a streaming graph.
 
typedef void(* db_stream_callback_t) (db_stream_node_t, void *)
 The db_stream_callback_t defines the callback function for a @ db_stream_node_t.
 

Enumerations

enum  db_aggregate_t {
  DB_AGGREGATE_COUNT ,
  DB_AGGREGATE_SUM ,
  DB_AGGREGATE_AVERAGE
}
 Aggregate Types.

 db_stream_create_join_all_within joins a number of input nodes into one output. More...
 

Detailed Description

Data streams provide a way to query, filter, and store data in real time.

Apply filters including aggregates, time windows and custom algorithms on edge data.

Function Documentation

◆ db_stream_create_graph()

dbstatus_t db_stream_create_graph ( db_stream_graph_t *  graph,
void *  mem,
size_t  size 
)

db_stream_create_graph creates a stream of given memory size.

Parameters
[out]graphDestination for database stream
memMemory used by the database stream
sizeSize of memory used by database stream
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

* Use this function to create a graph using mem of size. The stream graph is returned through a reference to graph.

◆ db_stream_free_graph()

void db_stream_free_graph ( db_stream_graph_t  graph,
size_t *  peak_memory_size 
)

db_stream_free_graph frees a graph previously created.

Parameters
[out]graphDestination for database connection handle
peak_memory_sizeName or alias of storage
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

*Use this function to free the memory used by the stream graph.

◆ db_stream_create_row_input()

dbstatus_t db_stream_create_row_input ( db_stream_node_t *  output,
db_stream_graph_t  graph,
const db_fielddef_t *  field_list,
const db_len_t  field_count,
db_fieldno_t  timestamp_field,
db_fieldno_t  key_field 
)

db_stream_create_row_input creates an input row to a streaming graph.

Parameters
[out]outputDestination node for output row
graphDestination graph to add row to
field_listSchema to use for output row
field_countNumber of fields used in schema
timestamp_fieldField index number data type
key_fieldField index number data type
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

* This function requires a stream graph to be initialized previously to this call. Use this function to create an input node to a data stream, the created node will be returned through a reference to output.

* The field_list contains the schema for an input row to the node.

◆ db_stream_set_sint32()

dbstatus_t db_stream_set_sint32 ( db_stream_node_t  stream,
db_fieldno_t  field,
int32_t  value 
)

db_stream_set_sint32 sets a signed 32 bit integer field of data stream.

Parameters
[in]streamStream node of field to be set
fieldDestination field to set
valueValue of stream to set
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

Use this function to set the field of the stream node stream to the value of value.

◆ db_stream_process()

dbstatus_t db_stream_process ( db_stream_node_t  stream)

db_stream_process processes the fields set currently in the stream.

Parameters
[in]streamStream to process
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

* This function will process the current input(s) of the stream at the time of calling it.

◆ db_stream_create_row_output()

dbstatus_t db_stream_create_row_output ( db_stream_node_t *  output,
db_stream_node_t  input,
db_stream_callback_t  callback,
void *  argument 
)

db_stream_create_row_output creates an output row to a streaming graph.

Parameters
[out]outputDestination node for output row
inputDestination graph to add row to
callback(OPtional) Reference to a callback function
argument(Optional) Argument to callback function
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

* Use this function to create a node to process output from the stream input using the callback function (optional) callback provided with the optional argument argument to the callback function.

* The output is returned via reference to the output node by output.

◆ db_stream_get_tag()

char db_stream_get_tag ( db_stream_node_t  stream)

db_stream_get_tag gets the tag of an entry in a data stream.

Parameters
streamDestination stream to get tag from
Returns
'+' for a new entry in the stream '-' for a deletion in the stream 'U' for an update in the stream

* Use this function to get the tag from an entry in a data stream, this function can be used inside a callback function to the streaming node stream.

◆ db_stream_get_transaction_timestamp()

int64_t db_stream_get_transaction_timestamp ( db_stream_node_t  stream)

db_stream_get_transaction_timestamp gets the timestamp value of the most recent transaction.

Parameters
streamDestination node for output row
Returns
Timestamp value of transaction

Use this function to return the latest transaction made from a streaming node.

◆ db_stream_get_sint32()

int32_t db_stream_get_sint32 ( db_stream_node_t  stream,
db_fieldno_t  field 
)

db_stream_get_sint32 gets the value of the given field.

Parameters
streamTarget stream to get the value from
fieldField to get the target value from
Returns
Signed 32 bit integer

* This function returns the value from the output node stream at the given field field.

◆ db_stream_create_queue()

dbstatus_t db_stream_create_queue ( db_stream_node_t *  output,
db_stream_node_t  input,
size_t  queue_row_count 
)

db_stream_create_queue creates a buffer of stream results in a queue.

Parameters
[out]outputTarget node to queue results in
inputInput node that inserts rows to the queue
queue_row_countMaximum number of entries to store in the queue
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

◆ db_stream_queue_next()

dbstatus_t db_stream_queue_next ( db_stream_node_t  queue)

db_stream_queue_next creates a buffer of stream results in a queue.

Parameters
[out]outputTarget node to queue results in
inputInput node that inserts rows to the queue
queue_row_countMaximum number of entries to store in the queue
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

◆ db_stream_create_filter_uint64()

dbstatus_t db_stream_create_filter_uint64 ( db_stream_node_t *  output,
db_stream_node_t  input,
db_fieldno_t  field,
db_seek_t  compare_op,
uint64_t  value 
)

db_stream_create_filter_uint64 creates a filter on the input node.

Parameters
[out]outputOutput node from filter
inputInput node to supply row to filter on
fieldField of input row to apply filter to
compare_opType of filter to apply
valueValue to use with filter
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

* Use this function to create a filter on a streaming node. The compare_op will be applied on the input node on the given field using the value.

The output node containing the applied filter is returned through reference to output.

◆ db_stream_create_time_interval_window()

dbstatus_t db_stream_create_time_interval_window ( db_stream_node_t *  output,
db_stream_node_t  input,
db_timestamp_usec_t  window_size,
int32_t  buffer_row_count 
)

db_stream_create_time_interval_window creates a range of timestamps called a window.

Parameters
[out]outputOutput node with window applied
inputInput node that supplies row to window
window_sizeSize of the window, in microseconds (us)
buffer_row_countSize of the buffer to queue the window (number of entries)
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

* Use this function to create a time window on a streaming node. The time window will have a window_size amount of time. The buffer_row_count indicates the number of entries that get buffered before processed into the window.

The output node containing the applied filter is returned through reference to output.

◆ db_stream_create_aggregates()

dbstatus_t db_stream_create_aggregates ( db_stream_node_t *  output,
db_stream_node_t  input,
db_fieldno_t *  field_list,
enum db_aggregate_t *  aggregate_list,
size_t  aggregate_count 
)

db_stream_create_aggregates creates a list of aggregates to apply.

Parameters
[out]outputOutput node with aggregate(s) applied
inputInput node that supplies entries to the aggregates
field_listFields to apply to aggregate, Note - the number of entries in the field list must match the number of entries in the aggregate list
aggregate_listList of aggregates to apply to input
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

* This function creates a list of aggregates to be applied on the given field_list.

The output node containing the applied filter is returned through reference to output.

◆ db_stream_create_join_all_within()

dbstatus_t db_stream_create_join_all_within ( db_stream_node_t *  output,
db_stream_node_t *  input_list,
db_fieldno_t *  join_key_list,
int32_t  join_source_count,
int64_t  within_time_interval 
)

db_stream_create_join_all_within joins a number of input nodes into one output.

Parameters
[out]outputOutput node with join applied
input_listList of input nodes to join on
join_key_listList of keys to join inputs on
join_source_countNumer of inputs to join on
within_time_intervalWindow of time (in microseconds) to join on
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

* This function joins the row entries from the stream nodes defined in input_list according the keys defined in the join_source_count and within the time interval defined by within_time_interval.
